translated: But if, O Mahāmati, I were desirous of granting permission,

original: kalpyaṃ vā me śrāvakāṇāṃ pratisevituṃ syāt /
analyzed: kalpyam vā me śrāvakāṇām pratisevitum syāt
translated: or if it were proper for my disciples to partake of,

original: nāhaṃ maitrīvihāriṇāṃ yogināṃ yogācārāṇāṃ śmaśānikānāṃ mahāyānasaṃprasthitānāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṝṇāṃ ca sarvasattvaikaputrakasaṃjñābhāvanārthaṃ sarvāmāṃsabhakṣaṇapratiṣedhaṃ kuryām /
analyzed: na aham maitrī vihāriṇām yoginām yoga ācārāṇām śmaśānikānām mahāyāna saṃprasthitānām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṝṇām ca sarva sattva eka putraka saṃjñā bhāvanā artham sarva a māṃsa bhakṣaṇa pratiṣedham kuryām
translated: I would not prohibit the eating of all meat for those who dwell in friendliness, for yogis, for practitioners of yoga, for those who dwell in charnel grounds, for sons and daughters of noble family who have set out in the Great Vehicle, in order to cultivate the perception of all beings as their only child.

analyzed: kṛtavān ca
translated: And I have done so.

original: asmin mahāmate dharmakāmānāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṝṇāṃ ca sarvayānasaṃprasthitānāṃ śmaśānikānāṃ maitrīvihāriṇāmāraṇyakānāṃ yogināṃ yogācārāṇāṃ sarvayogasādhanāya sarvasattvaikaputrakasaṃjñābhāvanārthaṃ sarvamāṃsapratiṣedham //
analyzed: asmin mahāmate dharma kāmānām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṝṇām ca sarva yāna saṃprasthitānām śmaśānikānām maitrī vihāriṇām āraṇyakānām yoginām yoga ācārāṇām sarva yoga sādhanāya sarva sattva eka putraka saṃjñā bhāvanā artham sarva māṃsa pratiṣedham
translated: O Mahāmati, for the sons and daughters of noble family who desire the Dharma, who have set out in all vehicles, who dwell in charnel grounds, who dwell in friendliness, who dwell in the forest, who are yogis, who are practitioners of yoga, in order to accomplish all yoga and to cultivate the perception of all beings as their only child, I have prohibited all meat.

original: tatra tatra deśanāpāṭhe śikṣāpadānāmanupūrvībandhaṃ niḥśreṇīpadavinyāsayogena trikoṭiṃ baddhvā na taduddiśya kṛtāni pratiṣiddhāni /
analyzed: tatra tatra deśanā pāṭhe śikṣā padānām anupūrvī bandham niḥśreṇī pada vinyāsa yogena trikoṭim baddhvā na tat uddiśya kṛtāni pratiṣiddhāni
translated: In that and that teaching, the sequence of precepts is bound like the placement of steps, binding the three aspects, and those not intended are prohibited.

analyzed: tatas daśa prakṛti mṛtāni api māṃsāni pratiṣiddhāni
translated: Then, the ten types of meat that are considered to be pure are also prohibited.

original: iha tu sūtre sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvaṃ nirupāyena sarvaṃ pratiṣiddham /
analyzed: iha tu sūtre sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam nirupāyena sarvam pratiṣiddham
translated: But in this sūtra, everything, in every way, by every means, and in every case, is prohibited without exception.

analyzed: yatas ham mahāmate māṃsa bhojanam na kasyacid anujñātavān  na anujānāmi
translated: Because, O Mahāmati, I have not permitted anyone to eat meat.🔽I do not permit it.

analyzed: na anujñāsyāmi
translated: I will not permit it.

analyzed: akalpyam mahāmate pravrajitānām māṃsa bhojanam iti vadāmi
translated: O Mahāmati, I declare that eating meat is unsuitable for renunciants.

original: yadapi ca mahāmate mamābhyākhyānaṃ dātavyaṃ maṃsyante tathāgatenāpi paribhuktamiti /
analyzed: yat api ca mahāmate mama abhyākhyānam dātavyam maṃsyante tathāgatena api paribhuktam iti
translated: And if, O Mahāmati, they think that meat should be eaten because it was consumed by the Tathāgata,

original: tadanyeṣāṃ mahāmate mohapuruṣāṇāṃ svakarmadoṣāvaraṇāvṛtānāṃ dīrgharātramanarthāyāhitāya saṃvartakaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tat anyeṣām mahāmate moha puruṣāṇām sva karma doṣa āvaraṇa āvṛtānām dīrgharātram anarthāya ahitāya saṃvartakam bhaviṣyati
translated: that will lead to misfortune and harm for a long time for other deluded people, O Mahāmati, who are covered by the obscurations of their own karmic faults.

analyzed: na hi mahāmate ārya śrāvakāḥ prākṛta manuṣya āhāram āharanti
translated: For, O Mahāmati, the noble disciples do not eat ordinary human food,

analyzed: kutas eva māṃsa rudhiḥ āhāram a kalpyam
translated: how much less meat and blood, which is unsuitable.

original: dharmāhārā hi mahāmate mama śrāvakāḥ pratyekabuddhā bodhisattvāśca nāmiṣāhārāḥ /
analyzed: dharma āhārāḥ hi mahāmate mama śrāvakāḥ pratyekabuddhāḥ bodhisattvāḥ ca na āmiṣa āhārāḥ
translated: O Mahāmati, my disciples, the pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas, eat the food of Dharma, not the food of flesh.

analyzed: prāk eva tathāgatāḥ
translated: How much less so the Tathāgatas.

original: dharmakāyā hi mahāmate tathāgatā dharmāhārasthitayo nāmiṣakāyā na sarvāmiṣāhārasthitayo vāntasarvabhavopakaraṇatṛṣṇaiṣaṇāvāsanāḥ sarvakleśadoṣavāsanāpagatāḥ suvimuktacittaprajñāḥ sarvajñāḥ sarvadarśinaḥ sarvasattvaikaputrakasamadarśino mahākāruṇikāḥ /
analyzed: dharma kāyāḥ hi mahāmate tathāgatāḥ dharma āhāra sthitayaḥ na āmiṣa kāyāḥ na sarva āmiṣa āhāra sthitayaḥ vānta sarva bhava upakaraṇa tṛṣṇā eṣaṇā vāsanāḥ sarva kleśa doṣa vāsanā apagatāḥ su vimukta citta prajñāḥ sarvajñāḥ sarva darśinaḥ sarva sattva eka putraka sama darśinaḥ mahā kāruṇikāḥ
translated: For, O Mahāmati, the Tathāgatas have the Dharma-body, and abide in the food of Dharma, not in the body of flesh, not in all the food of flesh, having abandoned all craving and seeking for the requisites of existence, having shaken off all the tendencies to the faults of the passions, their minds and wisdom well liberated, all-knowing, all-seeing, regarding all beings as their only child, great compassionate ones.

original: so'haṃ mahāmate sarvasattvaikaputrakasaṃjñī san kathamiva svaputramāṃsamanujñāsyāmi paribhoktuṃ śrāvakebhyaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ uham mahāmate sarva sattva eka putraka saṃjñī san katham iva sva putra māṃsam anujñāsyāmi paribhoktum śrāvakebhyaḥ
translated: Then, O Mahāmati, regarding all beings as my only child, how could I allow my own son's flesh to be eaten by my disciples?

analyzed: kutas eva svayam paribhoktum
translated: How much less could I myself eat it?

original: anujñātavānasmi śrāvakebhyaḥ svayaṃ vā paribhuktavāniti mahāmate nedaṃ sthānaṃ vidyate //
analyzed: anujñātavān asmi śrāvakebhyaḥ svayam vā paribhuktavān iti mahāmate na idam sthānam vidyate
translated: O Mahāmati, it is not possible that I have allowed it to be eaten by my disciples or have eaten it myself.

analyzed: tatra idam ucyate
translated: Herein it is said:

original: madyaṃ māṃsaṃ palāṇḍuṃ na bhakṣayeyaṃ mahāmune /
analyzed: madyam māṃsam palāṇḍum na bhakṣayeyam mahā mune
translated: I will not eat wine, meat, or onions, O Great Sage.

analyzed: bodhisattvaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ bhāṣadbhiḥ jina puṃgavaiḥ  an ārya juṣṭa durgandham akīrti karam eva ca
translated: It is said by the Bodhisattvas, the Great Beings, the Foremost Victors.🔽Meat, which is abhorrent to the noble ones, foul-smelling, and a cause of disrepute,

analyzed: kravyāda bhojanam māṃsam brūhi abhakṣyam mahā mune
translated: Declare it to be inedible, O Great Sage.

original: bhakṣyamāṇe ca ye deṣā abhakṣye tu guṇāśca ye /
analyzed: bhakṣyamāṇe ca ye abhakṣye tu guṇāḥ ca ye
translated: The faults that are in eating meat, and the virtues that are in not eating meat,

original: mahāmate nibodha tvaṃ ye doṣā māṃsabhakṣaṇe // //
analyzed: mahāmate nibodha tvam ye doṣāḥ māṃsa bhakṣaṇe
translated: O greatly wise one, understand the faults that are in eating meat.

analyzed: sva ajanyāt vyabhicārāt ca śukra śoṇita saṃbhavāt
translated: Because of adultery with one's own relatives, and because of being born from semen and blood,

analyzed: udvejanīyam bhūtānām yogī māṃsam vivarjayet
translated: The yogi should avoid meat that is frightening to beings.

original: māṃsāni ca palāṇḍūṃśca madyāni vividhāni ca /🔽gṛñjanaṃ laśunaṃ caiva yogī nityaṃ vivarjayet // //
analyzed: māṃsāni ca palāṇḍūn ca madyāni vividhāni ca  gṛñjanam laśunam ca eva yogī nityam vivarjayet
translated: Meat, onions, and various kinds of alcohol,🔽The yogi should always avoid leeks and garlic.

analyzed: mrakṣaṇam varjayet tailam śalya viddheṣu na svapet
translated: One should avoid oil for anointing, and should not sleep when wounded by a thorn,

analyzed: chidra acchidreṣu sattvānām yat ca sthānam mahat bhayam
translated: In the holes and crevices where beings have great fear.

analyzed: āhārāt jāyate darpaḥ saṃkalpaḥ darpa saṃbhavaḥ
translated: From food arises pride, and from pride arises intention.

analyzed: saṃkalpa janitaḥ rājaḥ tasmāt api na bhakṣayet
translated: O king, from intention also one should not eat.

analyzed: saṃkalpāt jāyate rāgaḥ cittam rāgeṇa muhyate
translated: From intention arises passion, and the mind is deluded by passion.

original: mūḍhasya saṃgatirbhavati jāyate na ca mucyate // //
analyzed: mūḍhasya saṃgatiḥ bhavati jāyate na ca mucyate  /
translated: For the deluded one, attachment arises and one is born and does not become liberated.

original: lābhārthaṃ hanyate sattvo māṃsārthaṃ dīyate dhanam /
analyzed: lābha artham hanyate sattvaḥ māṃsa artham dīyate dhanam
translated: For the sake of profit, a being is killed, and for the sake of meat, money is given.

analyzed: ubhau tau pāpa karmāṇau pacyete raurava ādiṣu
translated: Both of them, the doers of evil, are cooked in the Raurava and other hells.

analyzed: yaḥ atikramya muneḥ vākyam māṃsam bhakṣati durmatiḥ
translated: The one who, with an evil mind, eats meat, transgressing the sage's words,

original: lokadvayavināśārthaṃ dīkṣitaḥ śākyaśāsane // //🔽te yānti paramaṃ ghoraṃ narakaṃ pāpakarmiṇaḥ /
analyzed: loka dvaya vināśa artham dīkṣitaḥ śākya śāsane  te yānti paramam ghoram narakam pāpa karmiṇaḥ
translated: Is initiated in the Shakyamuni's teachings for the destruction of both worlds.🔽Those who engage in such evil actions go to the most terrible hell,

analyzed: raurava ādiṣu raudreṣu pacyante māṃsa khādakāḥ
translated: Where the meat-eaters are cooked in the terrible hells beginning with Raurava.

analyzed: tri koṭi śuddha māṃsam vai akalpitam a yācitam
translated: Meat that is pure in the three aspects, not prepared, not requested,

original: acoditaṃ ca naivāsti tasmānmāṃsaṃ na bhakṣayet // //
analyzed: a coditam ca na eva asti tasmāt māṃsam na bhakṣayet
translated: And not instructed, does not exist. Therefore, one should not eat meat.

original: māṃsaṃ na bhakṣayedyogī mayā buddhaiśca garhitam /
analyzed: māṃsam na bhakṣayet yogī mayā buddhaiḥ ca garhitam
translated: The yogi should not eat meat, as it is condemned by me and the Buddhas.

analyzed: anyonya bhakṣaṇāḥ sattvāḥ kravyāda kula saṃbhavāḥ
translated: Beings who eat each other are born in families of carnivorous animals.

analyzed: durgandhiḥ kutsanīyaḥ ca unmattaḥ ca api jāyate
translated: One is born with a foul smell, is despised, and becomes insane.

original: caṇḍālapukkasakule ḍombeṣu ca punaḥ punaḥ // //🔽ḍākinījātiyonyāśca māṃsāde jāyate kule /
analyzed: caṇḍāla pukkasa kule ḍombeṣu ca punar punar  ḍākinī jāti yonyāḥ ca māṃsa āde jāyate kule
translated: Again and again, one is born in the families of Chandalas, Pukkasas, and Dombas.🔽One is born in the womb of a Dakini and in a meat-eating family.

analyzed: rākṣasī mārjāra yonau ca jāyate au nara udhamaḥ
translated: That lowest of men is born in the wombs of Rakshasas and cats.

analyzed: hasti kakṣye mahā medhe nirvāṇa aṅguli mālike
translated: In the great meditation of the elephant-keeper, in the Nirvana-Angulimalika,

analyzed: laṅkāvatāra sūtre ca mayā māṃsam vivarjitam
translated: And in the Lankavatara Sutra, I have abandoned meat.

analyzed: buddhaiḥ ca bodhisattvaiḥ ca śrāvakaiḥ ca vigarhitam
translated: It is condemned by the Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, and Shravakas.

analyzed: khādate yadi nairlajjyāt unmattaḥ jāyate sadā
translated: If one eats it out of shamelessness, one will always be born insane.

original: sadasanto na vidyante bhāvāḥ svapnopamā ime // //
analyzed: sat asantaḥ na vidyante bhāvāḥ svapna upamāḥ ime
translated: These existent and non-existent things do not exist, they are like dreams.

analyzed: svabhāvam ekam deśemi tarka vijñapti varjitam
translated: I teach the one nature, free from conceptualization and cognition,

analyzed: āryāṇām gocaram divyam svabhāva dvaya varjitam
translated: The divine domain of the noble ones, free from the two natures.

original: khadyotā iva mattasya yathā citrā na santi ca /
analyzed: khadyotāḥ iva mattasya yathā citrāḥ na santi ca
translated: Just as the various colors of a firefly are not real to the intoxicated,

analyzed: dṛśyante dhātu saṃkṣobhāt evam lokaḥ svabhāvataḥ
translated: So the world, by its own nature, is seen due to the disturbance of the elements.

analyzed: tṛṇa kāṣṭha kaṭhalleṣu yathā māyā virājate
translated: Just as an illusion manifests in grass, wood, and clods of earth,

original: na cāsau vidyate māyā evaṃ dharmāḥ svabhāvataḥ // //
analyzed: na ca asau vidyate māyā evam dharmāḥ svabhāvataḥ
translated: So are phenomena by their own nature, and that illusion does not exist.

original: na grāhako na ca grāhyaṃ na bandhyo na ca bandhanam /🔽māyāmarīcisadṛśaṃ svapnākhyaṃ timiraṃ yathā // //
analyzed: na grāhakaḥ na ca grāhyam na bandhyaḥ na ca bandhanam  māyā marīci sadṛśam svapna ākhyam timiram yathā
translated: There is no grasper, nothing to be grasped, no bondage, and no bondage.🔽Like an illusion, a mirage, a dream, and a visual aberration.

analyzed: yadā paśyati tattva arthī nirvikalpaḥ nirañjanaḥ
translated: When a seeker of the truth, free from conceptualization and attachment, sees,

original: tadā yogaṃ samāpanno drakṣyate māṃ na saṃśayaḥ // //
analyzed: tadā yogam samāpannaḥ drakṣyate mām na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Then, having attained yoga, he will see me, there is no doubt.

analyzed: na hi atra kācid vijñaptiḥ nabhe yadvat marīcayaḥ
translated: For here there is no manifestation, like mirages in the sky.

analyzed: evam dharmān vijānantaḥ na kiṃcid pratijānati
translated: Knowing phenomena in this way, one does not know anything at all.

analyzed: sat asataḥ pratyayeṣu dharmāṇām na asti saṃbhavaḥ
translated: In conditions, there is no origination of existent or non-existent phenomena.

original: bhrāntaṃ traidhātuke cittaṃ vicitraṃ khyāyate yataḥ // //
analyzed: bhrāntam traidhātuke cittam vicitram khyāyate yatas
translated: Because the mind appears as various in the three realms, it is deluded.

analyzed: svapnam ca lokam ca sama svabhāvam
translated: The world and dreams have the same nature.

original: rūpāṇi citrāṇi hi tatra cāpi /🔽dṛśyanti bhogaṃ spariśaṃ samānaṃ
analyzed: rūpāṇi citrāṇi hi tatra ca api  dṛśyanti bhogam spariśam samānam
translated: There, various forms are seen.

analyzed: deha antagam loka gurum kriyām ca
translated: The experience is the same, but the world's teacher and action end with the body.

analyzed: cittam hi
translated: The mind is the womb of the three realms.

analyzed: dbhrāntam hi cittam iha amutra dṛśyate
translated: The deluded mind is seen here and there.

analyzed: na kalpayet lokam asattaḥ eṣā
translated: One should not imagine this world to be non-existent.

analyzed: mā etādṛśīm loka gatim viditvā
translated: Knowing the course of the world to be like this,

analyzed: saṃbhavam vibhavam ca eva mohāt paśyanti bāliśāḥ
translated: The foolish see origination and destruction due to delusion.

original: na saṃbhavaṃ na vibhavaṃ prajñāyukto vipaśyati // //
analyzed: na saṃbhavam na vibhavam prajñā yuktaḥ vipaśyati
translated: One endowed with wisdom sees neither origination nor destruction.

analyzed: akaniṣṭha bhavane divye sarva pāpa vivarjite
translated: In the divine abode of Akaniṣṭha, free from all evil,

analyzed: nirvikalpāḥ sadā yuktāḥ citta caitta vivarjitāḥ
translated: The non-conceptual ones are always concentrated, free from mind and mental factors.

analyzed: bala abhijñā vaśi prāptāḥ tad samādhi gatiṃgatāḥ
translated: Having attained the powers, higher knowledges, and mastery, they have attained that concentration.

analyzed: tatra budhyanti saṃbuddhāḥ nirmitaḥ tu iha budhyate
translated: The fully enlightened ones awaken there, while an emanation awakens here.

analyzed: nirmāṇa koṭyaḥ hi amitāḥ buddhānām niścaranti ca
translated: Infinite millions of emanations of the buddhas emerge.

original: sarvatra bālāḥ śṛṇvanti dharmaṃ tebhyaḥ pratiśrutvā / // //🔽ādimadhyāntanirmuktaṃ bhāvābhāvavivarjitam /
analyzed: sarvatra bālāḥ śṛṇvanti dharmam tebhyaḥ pratiśrutvā  ādi madhya anta nirmuktam bhāva abhāva vivarjitam
translated: Everywhere, the foolish listen to the Dharma, having heard it from them,🔽Free from beginning, middle, and end, devoid of existence and non-existence,

analyzed: vyāpinam acalam śuddham acitram citra saṃbhavam
translated: Pervasive, unmoving, pure, unvaried, yet arising in various ways,

analyzed: vijñapti gotra saṃchannam ālīnam sarva dehinām
translated: Concealed in the lineage of representations, hidden from all embodied beings,

original: bhrānteśca vidyate māyā na māyā bhrāntikāraṇam // //
analyzed: bhrānteḥ ca vidyate māyā na māyā bhrānti kāraṇam
translated: And illusion exists due to delusion, but illusion is not the cause of delusion.

analyzed: cittasya mohena api asti yat kiṃcid api vidyate
translated: Whatever exists at all exists due to the delusion of the mind,

analyzed: svabhāva dvaya nibaddham ālayavijñāna nirmitam
translated: Bound by the duality of intrinsic nature, created by the store-consciousness,

analyzed: lokam vijñaptimātram ca dṛṣṭi augham dharma pudgalam
translated: The world, mere representation, the stream of views, the individual and phenomena,

original: vibhāvya lokamevaṃ tu parāvṛtto yadā bhavet /
analyzed: vibhāvya lokam evam tu parāvṛttaḥ yadā bhavet
translated: Having thus contemplated the world, when it is transformed,

analyzed: tadā putraḥ bhavet mahyam niṣpanna dharma vartakaḥ
translated: Then he becomes my son, the accomplished Dharma-practitioner.

analyzed: uṣṇa drava cala kaṭhināḥ dharmāḥ bālaiḥ vikalpitāḥ
translated: Heat, moisture, motion, and solidity are conceptualized by the foolish as phenomena,

analyzed: asat bhūta samāropaḥ na asti lakṣyam na lakṣaṇam
translated: There is no superimposition of what is unreal, no characterized object and no characteristic,

analyzed: aṣṭa dravyakam etat tu kāya saṃsthānam indriyam
translated: But this body-form consisting of eight substances is the sense-faculty,

original: rūpaṃ kalpanti vai bālā bhrāntāḥ saṃsārapañjare // //
analyzed: rūpam kalpanti vai bālāḥ bhrāntāḥ saṃsāra pañjare
translated: The foolish, deluded in the cage of saṃsāra, conceive of form as real.

analyzed: hetu pratyaya sāmagryā bālāḥ kalpanti saṃbhavam
translated: Fools imagine existence through the collection of causes and conditions.

analyzed: a jānānāḥ nayam idam bhramanti tri bhava ālaye
translated: Not knowing this principle, they wander in the abode of the three existences.

original: sarvabhāvāsvabhāvā ca vacanamapi nṛṇām /🔽kalpanāccāpi nirmāṇaṃ nāsti svapnopamaṃ bhavam /
analyzed: sarva bhāva asvabhāvā ca vacanam api nṛṇām  kalpanāt ca api nirmāṇam na asti svapna upamam bhavam
translated: And all things are without self-nature, even the words of humans.🔽And because of conceptualization, there is no creation, existence is like a dream.

analyzed: parīkṣet na saṃsaret na api nirvāyāt
translated: One should examine, not transmigrate, nor attain nirvana.

analyzed: cittam vicitram bīja ākhyam khyāyate citta gocaram
translated: The mind, with various seeds, appears as the object of the mind.

original: khyātau kalpanti utpattiṃ bālāḥ kalpadvaye ratāḥ // //
analyzed: khyātau kalpanti utpattim bālāḥ kalpa dvaye ratāḥ
translated: When it appears, fools, attached to the two kinds of conceptualization, imagine arising.

original: ajñāna tṛṣṇā karmaṃ ca cittacaittā na mārakam /
analyzed: ajñāna tṛṣṇā karmam ca citta caittāḥ na mārakam
translated: Ignorance, craving, and karma are not the killers, but the mind and mental factors.

analyzed: pravartati tatas yasmāt pāratantryam hi tat matam
translated: From that, it proceeds, therefore it is considered to be dependent.

analyzed: te ca kalpanti yat vastu citta gocara vibhramam
translated: And they imagine that object which is the error of the mind's domain.

analyzed: kalpanāyām aniṣpannam mithyā bhrānti vikalpitam
translated: In conceptualization, it is unestablished, falsely imagined through delusion.

analyzed: cittam pratyaya saṃbaddham pravartati śarīriṇām
translated: The mind, connected with conditions, proceeds in embodied beings.

analyzed: pratyayebhyaḥ vinirmuktam na paśyāmi vadāmi aham
translated: I do not see, I say, it is released from conditions.

analyzed: pratyayebhyaḥ vinirmuktam sva lakṣaṇa vivarjitam
translated: Released from conditions, devoid of specific characteristics,

original: na tiṣṭhati yadā dehe tena mahyamagocaram // //
analyzed: na tiṣṭhati yadā dehe tena mahyam agocaram
translated: When it does not abide in the body, it is beyond my perception.

analyzed: rājā śreṣṭhī yathā putrān vicitraiḥ mṛga sādṛśaiḥ
translated: Just as a king or a merchant delights his sons with various animals and birds,

original: pralobhya krīḍati gṛhe vane mṛgasamāgamam // //🔽tathāhaṃ lakṣaṇaiścitrairdharmāṇāṃ pratibimbakaiḥ /
analyzed: pralobhya krīḍati gṛhe vane mṛga samāgamam   tathā aham lakṣaṇaiḥ citraiḥ dharmāṇām pratibimbakaiḥ
translated: and plays with them in the house, but in the forest he meets with real animals,

analyzed: pratyātma vedyām hi sutām bhūtakoṭim vadāmi aham
translated: in the same way, I speak of the ultimate reality, which is to be realized by each individual, with various characteristics and reflections of phenomena.

analyzed: taraṃgāḥ hi udadheḥ yadvat pavana pratyaya uditāḥ
translated: Just as the waves in the ocean, arisen from the wind,

original: nṛtyamānāḥ pravartante vyucchedaścaḥ na vidyate // //🔽ālayaughastathā nityaṃ viṣayapavaneritaḥ /
analyzed: nṛtyamānāḥ pravartante vyucchedaḥ caḥ na vidyate  / ālaya oghaḥ tathā nityam viṣaya pavana īritaḥ
translated: dance and move, and their cessation is not known,🔽in the same way, the stream of the store-consciousness, always impelled by the wind of objects,

analyzed: citraiḥ taraṃga vijñānaiḥ nṛtyamānaḥ pravartate
translated: moves, dancing with various wave-like cognitions.

analyzed: grāhya grāhaka bhāvena cittam namati dehinām
translated: The mind of embodied beings inclines towards the notion of object and subject.

analyzed: dṛśyasya lakṣaṇam na asti yathā bālaiḥ vikalpyate
translated: The characteristic of the visible object is not as it is imagined by the ignorant.

analyzed: parama ālayavijñānam vijñaptiḥ ālayam punar
translated: The supreme store-consciousness is the store-consciousness again.

analyzed: grāhya grāhaka apagamāt tathatām deśayāmi aham
translated: Due to the absence of object and subject, I teach the suchness.

original: nāsti skandheṣvātmā na sattvo na ca pudgalaḥ /
analyzed: na asti skandheṣu ātmā na sattvaḥ na ca pudgalaḥ
translated: The self, the sentient being, and the person do not exist in the aggregates.

original: utpadyate ca vijñānaṃ vijñānaṃ ca nirudhyate // //
analyzed: utpadyate ca vijñānam vijñānam ca nirudhyate
translated: Consciousness arises, and consciousness ceases.

original: nimnonnataṃ yathā citre dṛśyate na ca vidyate /
analyzed: nimna unnatam yathā citre dṛśyate na ca vidyate
translated: Just as the high and low in a painting are seen but do not exist,

original: tathā bhāveṣu bhāvatvaṃ dṛśyate na ca vidyate // //
analyzed: tathā bhāveṣu bhāva tvam dṛśyate na ca vidyate
translated: So the existence of existents is seen but does not exist.

analyzed: gandharvanagaram yadvat yathā ca mṛgatṛṣṇikā
translated: Just as a gandharva city and a mirage,

original: dṛśyaṃ khyāti tathā nityaṃ prajñayā ca na vidyate // //
analyzed: dṛśyam khyāti tathā nityam prajñayā ca na vidyate
translated: The seen appears thus as eternal, but is not found by wisdom.

analyzed: pramāṇa indriya nirvṛttam na kāryam na api kāraṇam
translated: Free from means and senses, not an effect nor a cause,

analyzed: buddhi boddhavya rahitam lakṣya lakṣaṇa varjitam
translated: Free from intellect and the intelligible, devoid of the characterized and the characteristic,

original: skandhān pratītya saṃbuddho na dṛṣṭaḥ kenacitkvacit /
analyzed: skandhān pratītya saṃbuddhaḥ na dṛṣṭaḥ kenacid kvacid
translated: The fully enlightened one is not seen by anyone anywhere in dependence on the aggregates.

original: yo na dṛṣṭaḥ kvacitkena kutastasya vibhāvanā // //
analyzed: yaḥ na dṛṣṭaḥ kvacid kena kutas tasya vibhāvanā
translated: He who is not seen anywhere by anyone, how can he be realized?

analyzed: pratyayaiḥ hetu dṛṣṭāntaiḥ pratijñā kāraṇena ca
translated: By conditions, by examples of causes, and by the reason of the thesis,

analyzed: svapna gandharva cakreṇa marīcyā soma bhāskaraiḥ
translated: By a dream, a gandharva city, a mirage, the moon [reflected] in water, the sun,

analyzed: adṛśyam kula ādi dṛṣṭāntaiḥ utpattim vādayāmi aham
translated: I argue for the arising of the world, which is unseen by examples of families and so on.

analyzed: svapna vibhrama māyā ākhyam śūnyam vai kalpitam jagat
translated: The world, which is imagined to be empty, is called a dream, an illusion, and a magical creation.

analyzed: anāśritaḥ ca trailokye adhyātmam ca bahis tathā
translated: And he is not dependent in the three worlds, either internally or externally.

analyzed: anutpannam bhavam dṛṣṭvā kṣānti anutpatti jāyate
translated: Seeing the unborn nature of existence, acceptance of non-arising arises.

analyzed: māyā upama samādhim ca kāyam manaḥ mayam punar
translated: The meditative absorption like an illusion, and again the mind-made body,

original: abhijñā vaśitā tasya balā cittasya citritā // //
analyzed: abhijñā vaśitā tasya balā cittasya citritā  /
translated: His supernormal knowledge, mastery, and the variegated mind-power,

original: bhāvā yeṣāṃ hyanutpannāḥ śūnyā vai asvabhāvakāḥ /
analyzed: bhāvāḥ yeṣām hi anutpannāḥ śūnyāḥ vai asvabhāvakāḥ
translated: Those whose entities are unborn, empty, and without intrinsic nature,

analyzed: teṣām utpadyate bhrāntiḥ pratyayaiḥ ca nirudhyate
translated: Their delusion arises and is stopped by conditions.

original: cittaṃ hi khyāti cittasya bahirdhā khyāti rūpiṇaḥ /
analyzed: cittam hi khyāti cittasya bahirdhā khyāti rūpiṇaḥ
translated: The mind appears as the mind, appearing externally as form.

analyzed: anyat na vidyate dṛśyam yathā bālaiḥ vikalpyate
translated: There is no other visible object as imagined by the childish.

original: saṃkalā buddhabimbaṃ ca bhūtānāṃ ca vidāraṇam /
analyzed: saṃkalā buddha bimbam ca bhūtānām ca vidāraṇam
translated: The Buddha image in the aggregate, and the division of the elements,

analyzed: adhiṣṭhanti jagat citram prajñaptyā vai su śikṣitāḥ
translated: They overpower the variegated world, well-trained in designation.

analyzed: dehaḥ pratiṣṭhā bhogaḥ ca grāhya vijñaptayaḥ trayaḥ
translated: The body, the basis, and the enjoyments are the three perceptions of the object to be grasped.

analyzed: manaḥ udgraha vijñapti vikalpaḥ grāhakāḥ trayaḥ
translated: The mind, the grasping perception, and the conceptualization are the three perceivers.

analyzed: vikalpaḥ ca vikalpyam ca yāvat tu akṣara gocaram
translated: As long as there is conceptualization and the conceptualized, up to the domain of the indestructible,

analyzed: tāvat tattvam na paśyanti tārkikāḥ tarka vibhramāt
translated: For that long the logicians do not see reality due to the confusion of reasoning.

original: naiḥsvabhāvyaṃ hi bhāvānāṃ yadā budhyanti prajñayā /
analyzed: naiḥsvabhāvyam hi bhāvānām yadā budhyanti prajñayā
translated: When they understand the essencelessness of phenomena through wisdom,

analyzed: tadā viśramati yogī ā nimitta pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: Then the yogi rests, established in the signless.

analyzed: masi mrakṣitakaḥ yadvat gṛhyate kurkuṭaḥ budhaiḥ
translated: Just as a tortoise is grasped by the ignorant as a crow,

analyzed: saḥ eva ayam a jānānaiḥ bālaiḥ yāna trayam tathā
translated: so too, by the ignorant fools, the three vehicles are [grasped] in the same way.

analyzed: na hi atra śrāvakāḥ kecid na asti pratyeka yānikāḥ
translated: Here there are no śrāvakas at all, nor are there any pratyekabuddha vehicles.

analyzed: yat ca etat dṛśyate rūpam śrāvakasya jinasya ca
translated: And this form that is seen, of the śrāvaka and the Jina,

analyzed: nirmāṇam deśayanti ete bodhisattvāḥ kṛpā ātmakāḥ
translated: the bodhisattvas, who are compassionate, teach this as an emanation.

analyzed: vijñaptimātram tri bhavam svabhāva dvaya kalpitam
translated: The three worlds are mere representation, imagined to have two natures.

analyzed: parāvṛttaḥ tu tathatā dharma pudgala saṃcarāt
translated: But the transformation is suchness, due to the movement of dharmas and persons.

analyzed: soma bhāskara dīpa arciḥ bhūtāni maṇayaḥ tathā
translated: The sun, moon, lamp flames, elements, and jewels,

analyzed: nirvikalpāḥ pravartante tathā buddhasya buddha tā
translated: are without conceptualization, and so too the Buddha's enlightenment.

analyzed: keśoṇḍukam yathā mithyā gṛhyate taimiraiḥ janaiḥ
translated: Just as a hair-net is falsely grasped by people with eye disease,

analyzed: tathā bhāva vikalpaḥ yam mithyā bālaiḥ vikalpyate
translated: so too this conceptualization of existence is falsely conceptualized by fools.

analyzed: sthiti bhaṅga utpatti rahitāḥ nitya anitya vivarjitāḥ
translated: Free from abiding, destruction, and arising, devoid of permanence and impermanence,

analyzed: saṃkleśa vyavadāna ākhyāḥ bhāvāḥ keśoṇḍuka upamāḥ
translated: the phenomena called affliction and purification are like a hair-net.

analyzed: puttalikam yathā kaścid kanaka ābham paśyate jagat
translated: Just as someone sees the world as golden like a golden statue,

original: na hyasti kanakaṃ tatra bhūmiśca kanakāyate // //
analyzed: na hi asti kanakam tatra bhūmiḥ ca kanakāyate  /
translated: there is no gold there, but the earth appears golden.

analyzed: evam hi dūṣitāḥ bālāḥ citta caittaiḥ anādikaiḥ
translated: In the same way, fools are defiled by the beginningless mind and mental factors.

analyzed: māyā marīci prabhavam bhāvam gṛhṇanti tattvataḥ
translated: They grasp the reality that arises from illusion and mirage.

analyzed: eka bījam abījam ca samudraikam ca bījakam
translated: This mind is one seed, seedless, the ocean, and the seed of all.

analyzed: sarva bījakam api etat cittam paśyatha citrikam
translated: See this wonderful mind, which is all seeds.

analyzed: ekam bījam yadā śuddham parāvṛttam abījakam
translated: When the one seed is pure, it is the seedless supreme reversal.

analyzed: samam hi nirvikalpa tvāt udrekāt janma saṃkaraḥ
translated: For all are equal in being without conceptualization. The difference in birth is due to intensity.

analyzed: bījam āvahate citram sarvabījam tat ucyate  /
translated: The seed produces the variety, so it is called the seed of all.

analyzed: na hi atra utpadyate kiṃcid pratyayaiḥ na nirudhyate
translated: Here nothing arises or ceases due to conditions.

analyzed: utpadyante nirudhyante pratyayāḥ eva kalpitāḥ
translated: The conditions themselves, imagined, arise and cease.

analyzed: prajñapti mātram tri bhavam na asti vastu svabhāvataḥ
translated: The three realms are mere designation, not existing with intrinsic nature.

analyzed: prajñapti vastu bhāvena kalpayiṣyanti tārkikāḥ
translated: The logicians will imagine the existence of the designated thing.

analyzed: bhāva svabhāva jijñāsā na hi bhrāntiḥ nivāryate
translated: The inquiry into the intrinsic nature of existence does not stop delusion.

analyzed: bhāva svabhāva anutpattiḥ evam dṛṣṭvā vimucyate
translated: Seeing the non-arising of the nature of existence in this way, one is liberated.

analyzed: na māyā na asti sādharmyāt bhāvānām kathyate istitā
translated: The existence of things is not said to be like an illusion or non-existence.

analyzed: vitatha āśu vidyut sadṛśāḥ tena māyā upamāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: They are like a false flash of lightning, therefore they are remembered as being like an illusion.

original: na cotpadyā na cotpannāḥ pratyayo'pi na kecana /
analyzed: na ca utpadyāḥ na ca utpannāḥ na kecana
translated: They are not produced and have not arisen, and there are no conditions at all.

analyzed: saṃvidyante kvacid tena vyavahāram tu kathyate
translated: Therefore, existence is said to be a convention.

analyzed: na bhaṅga utpāda saṃkleśaḥ pratyayānām nivāryate
translated: The defilement of destruction and arising of conditions is not prevented.

analyzed: yat tu bālāḥ vikalpenti pratyayaiḥ saṃnivāryate
translated: But what fools imagine is prevented by conditions.

original: na svabhāvo na vijñaptirna vastu na ca ālayaḥ /
analyzed: na svabhāvaḥ na vijñaptiḥ na vastu na ca ālayaḥ
translated: There is no intrinsic nature, no representation, no object, and no store-consciousness.

analyzed: bālaiḥ vikalpitāḥ hi ete vaśa bhūtaiḥ ku tārkikaiḥ
translated: These are imagined by fools, who are under the power of false reasoning.

analyzed: cittamātram yadā lokam prapaśyanti jina ātmajāḥ
translated: When the Victorious Ones' children see the world as just mind,

analyzed: tadā nairvāṇikam kāyam kriyā saṃskāra varjitam
translated: then they attain the nirvāṇa-like body, free from the formations of action,

original: labhante te balābhijñāvaśitaiḥ saha saṃyutam // //🔽sarvarūpāvabhāsaṃ hi yadā cittaṃ pravartate /
analyzed: labhante te bala abhijñā vaśitaiḥ saha saṃyutam  sarva rūpa avabhāsam hi yadā cittam pravartate
translated: endowed with the powers, higher knowledges, and controls.🔽When the mind engages with the appearance of all forms,

original: nātra cittaṃ na rūpāṇi bhrāntaṃ cittamanādikam // //
analyzed: na atra cittam na rūpāṇi bhrāntam cittam anādikam
translated: there is no mind here, no forms. The beginningless mind is deluded.

original: tadā yogī hyanābhāsaṃ prajñayā paśyate jagat /
analyzed: tadā yogī hi anābhāsam prajñayā paśyate jagat
translated: Then the yogi sees the world as non-apparent through wisdom.

analyzed: nimittam vastu vijñaptiḥ manaḥ vispanditam ca yat
translated: The sign, the object, the manifestation, and the movement of the mind,

original: atikramya tu putrā me nirvikalpāścaranti te // //
analyzed: atikramya tu putrāḥ me nirvikalpāḥ caranti te
translated: Having transcended, my sons practice without conceptualization.

analyzed: gandharvanagaram māyā keśoṇḍuka marīcikā
translated: A gandharva city, an illusion, a hair-net, a mirage,

original: asatyāḥ satyataḥ khyānti tathā bhāveṣu bhāvanā // //
analyzed: asatyāḥ satyataḥ khyānti tathā bhāveṣu bhāvanā
translated: Unreal things appear as real, so is the conception of existents.

original: anutpannāḥ sarvabhāvā bhrāntimātraṃ hi dṛśyate /🔽bhrāntiṃ kalpenti utpannāṃ bālāṃ kalpadvaye ratāḥ // //
analyzed: anutpannāḥ sarva bhāvāḥ bhrānti mātram hi dṛśyate  bhrāntim kalpenti utpannām bālām kalpa dvaye ratāḥ
translated: All existents are unproduced, only delusion is seen.🔽The ignorant, attached to the two kinds of conceptualization, conceive of delusion as produced.

analyzed: aupapatti aṅgikam cittam vicitram vāsanā saṃbhavam
translated: The mind born of the factors of existence arises variously from latent tendencies,

analyzed: pravartate taraṃga ogham tad chedāt na pravartate
translated: Like a stream of waves, it ceases and does not arise.

analyzed: vicitra ālambanam citram yathā citte
translated: Just as the mind arises variously with various objects,

analyzed: tathā ākāśe ca kuḍye ca kasmāt na abhipravartate
translated: Why does it not arise in the same way in space and on a wall?

original: nimitaṃ kiṃcidālambya yadi cittaṃ pravartate /🔽pratyayairjanitaṃ cittaṃ cittamātraṃ na yujyate // //
analyzed: nimitam kiṃcid ālambya yadi cittam pravartate  pratyayaiḥ janitam cittam cittamātram na yujyate
translated: If the mind arises depending on some sign,🔽A mind produced by conditions is not tenable as mere mind.

analyzed: cittena gṛhyate cittam na asti kiṃcid sa hetukam
translated: The mind is grasped by the mind, there is nothing with a cause.

original: cittasya dharmatā śuddhā gagane nāsti vāsanā // //
analyzed: cittasya dharmatā śuddhā gagane na asti vāsanā
translated: The nature of mind is pure, there are no latent tendencies in space.

analyzed: sva citta abhiniveśena cittam vai saṃpravartate
translated: The mind functions due to attachment to one's own mind.

original: bahirdhā nāsti vai dṛśyamato vai cittamātrakam // //
analyzed: bahirdhā na asti vai dṛśyam atas vai cittamātrakam
translated: Externally, there is no visible object, therefore it is only mind.

analyzed: cittam ālayavijñānam manaḥ yat manyana ātmakam
translated: Mind is the store consciousness, the mental faculty is that which has the nature of conceiving,

original: gṛhṇāti viṣayān yena vijñānaṃ hi taducyate // //
analyzed: gṛhṇāti viṣayān yena vijñānam hi tat ucyate
translated: that by which one grasps objects is called consciousness.

analyzed: cittam avyākṛtam nityam manaḥ hi ubhaya saṃcaram
translated: The mind is always indeterminate, the mental faculty moves in both ways,

original: vartamānaṃ hi vijñānaṃ kuśalākuśalaṃ hi tat // //
analyzed: vartamānam hi vijñānam kuśala akuśalam hi tat
translated: the present consciousness is wholesome or unwholesome.

analyzed: dvāram hi parama arthasya vijñapti dvaya varjitam
translated: The door to the ultimate truth is free from the two kinds of representations,

analyzed: yāna traya vyavasthānam nirābhāse sthitam kutas
translated: how can the establishment of the three vehicles be based on the formless?

analyzed: cittamātram nirābhāsam vihārāḥ buddha bhūmiḥ ca
translated: Mind-only is free from appearances, the abodes are the stage of the Buddhas.

analyzed: etat hi bhāṣitam buddhaiḥ bhāṣante bhāṣayanti ca
translated: This has been taught by the Buddhas, they teach and will teach.

original: cittaṃ hi bhūmayaḥ sapta nirābhāsā ca aṣṭamī /
analyzed: cittam hi bhūmayaḥ sapta nirābhāsā ca aṣṭamī
translated: The mind is the seven stages, the eighth is free from appearances.

analyzed: dve bhūmayaḥ vihāraḥ ca śeṣā bhūmiḥ mama ātmikā
translated: Two stages are the abode, the remaining stages are my own nature.

analyzed: pratyātma vedyā śuddhā ca bhūmiḥ ca api mama ātmikā
translated: The stage that is to be known by oneself, and is pure, is also my own nature.

analyzed: māheśvara para sthānam akaniṣṭhe virājate  /
translated: Abides in the supreme realm of Mahesvara, in the Akanishtha heaven.

analyzed: hutāśanasya eva yathā niśceruḥ tasya raśmayaḥ
translated: Just as the rays of fire emerge,

analyzed: citrāḥ manoharāḥ saumyāḥ tri bhavam nirmiṇanti ye
translated: The variegated, delightful, gentle ones that create the three worlds.

analyzed: nirmāya tri bhavam kiṃcid kiṃcid vai pūrva nirmitam
translated: Having created the three worlds, some are created anew,

analyzed: tatra yānāni eṣā bhūmiḥ mama ātmikā
translated: There they teach the vehicles, this is my stage.

analyzed: na asti kālaḥ hi adhigame bhūmīnām kṣatresaṃkrame
translated: There is no time for attaining the stages, in the transition of the realms,

analyzed: cittamātram atikramya nirābhāse sthitam phalam
translated: Having transcended mere mind, the result abides in the non-conceptual.

original: asattā caiva sattā ca dṛśyate ca vicitratā /
analyzed: asattā ca eva sattā ca dṛśyate ca vicitra tā
translated: Non-existence and existence are seen, and variety is seen.

analyzed: bālāḥ grāha viparyastāḥ viparyāsaḥ hi citra tā
translated: The childish are deluded by grasping, for delusion is variety.

original: nirvikalpaṃ yadi jñānaṃ vastvastīti na yujyate /
analyzed: nirvikalpam yadi jñānam vastu asti iti na yujyate
translated: If knowledge is non-conceptual, it is not reasonable that an existent object exists.

original: yasmāccittaṃ na rūpāṇi nirvikalpaṃ hi tena tat // //
analyzed: yasmāt cittam na rūpāṇi nirvikalpam hi tena tat
translated: Because the mind is not forms, therefore it is non-conceptual.

analyzed: indriyāṇi ca māyā ākhyāḥ viṣayāḥ svapna saṃnibhāḥ
translated: The sense faculties are called illusions, the objects are like dreams,

original: kartā karma kriyā caiva sarvathāpi na vidyate // //
analyzed: kartā karma kriyā ca eva sarvathā api na vidyate
translated: The doer, the action, and the activity do not exist in any way.

analyzed: dhyānāni ca apramāṇāni ārūpyāḥ ca samādhayaḥ
translated: The meditations, the immeasurables, and the formless concentrations,

analyzed: saṃjñā nirodhaḥ nikhilaḥ cittamātre na vidyate
translated: The cessation of perception does not exist at all in mere mind.

analyzed: srotāpatti phalam ca eva sakṛdāgāmi phalam tathā
translated: The fruit of stream-entry, and likewise the fruit of once-returning,

analyzed: anāgāmi phalam ca eva arhat tvam citta vibhramaḥ
translated: The fruit of non-returning, and arhatship, are a confusion of mind.

analyzed: śūnyam anityam kṣaṇikam bālāḥ kalpanti saṃskṛtam
translated: Fools conceive of the conditioned as empty, impermanent, and momentary.

analyzed: nadī dīpa ādi dṛṣṭāntaiḥ kṣaṇika arthaḥ vikalpyate
translated: The meaning of momentariness is imagined through examples such as a river, a lamp, and so on.

analyzed: nirvyāpāram tu kṣaṇikam viviktam kriya varjitam
translated: But momentariness is without activity, isolated, and devoid of action.

analyzed: anutpattim ca dharmāṇām kṣaṇika artham vadāmi ahyam
translated: I declare the meaning of momentariness to be the non-arising of phenomena.

analyzed: sat ca asataḥ hi anutpādaḥ sāṃkhya vaiśeṣikaiḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The non-arising of the existent and non-existent is remembered by the Sāṃkhyas and Vaiśeṣikas.

analyzed: avyākṛtāni sarvāṇi taiḥ eva hi prakāśitam
translated: All indeterminate [states] are indeed revealed by them.

analyzed: caturvidham vyākaraṇam eka aṃśa paripṛcchanam
translated: There are four kinds of answers: a one-sided answer, a question to be clarified,

analyzed: vibhajya sthāpanīyam ca tīrtha vāda nivāraṇam
translated: And one to be set aside, and one to be answered with a question.

original: sarvaṃ vidyati saṃvṛtyāṃ paramārthe na vidyate /
analyzed: sarvam saṃvṛtyām paramārthe na vidyate
translated: Everything exists conventionally, but not ultimately.

analyzed: dharmāṇām niḥsvabhāva tvam paramārthe api dṛśyate
translated: The essencelessness of phenomena is seen even in the ultimate.

analyzed: upalabdhi niḥsvabhāve saṃvṛtiḥ tena ucyate
translated: Convention is said to be the essencelessness of perception.

analyzed: abhilāpa hetukaḥ bhāvaḥ svabhāvaḥ yadi vidyate
translated: If existence has its own nature caused by verbal expression,

original: abhilāpasaṃbhavo bhāvo nāstīti ca na vidyate // //🔽nirvastuko hyabhilāpastatsaṃvṛtyāpi na vidyate /
analyzed: abhilāpa saṃbhavaḥ bhāvaḥ na asti iti ca na vidyate  nirvastukaḥ hi abhilāpaḥ tat saṃvṛtya api na vidyate
translated: The possibility of verbal expression does not exist, and existence does not exist.🔽For verbal expression is without substance, and does not exist even conventionally.

analyzed: viparyāsasya vastu tvāt ca upalabdhiḥ na vidyate
translated: And because error is the substance, perception does not exist.

analyzed: vidyate ced viparyāsaḥ naiḥsvābhāvyam na vidyate
translated: If error exists, non-inherent existence does not exist.

analyzed: viparyāsasya vastu tvāt yat yat eva upalabhyate
translated: Whatever is perceived due to error being the substance,

original: niḥsvabhāvaṃ bhavettaddhi sarvathāpi na vidyate // //🔽yadetaddṛśyate citraṃ cittaṃ dauṣṭhulyavāsitam /
analyzed: niḥsvabhāvam bhavet tat hi sarvathā api na vidyate  yat etat dṛśyate citram cittam dauṣṭhulya vāsitam
translated: That would be without inherent existence, and does not exist in any way.🔽This variegated appearance is seen due to the mind being perfumed by coarseness.

analyzed: rūpa avabhāsa grahaṇam bahirdhā citta vibhramam
translated: The apprehension of the appearance of form is an external error of the mind.

analyzed: vikalpena avikalpena vikalpaḥ hi prahīyate
translated: For conceptualization is abandoned by non-conceptualization,

analyzed: vikalpena avikalpena śūnyatā tattva darśanam
translated: And the vision of the reality of emptiness is by conceptualization and non-conceptualization.

original: māyāhastī yathā citraṃ patrāṇi kanakā yathā /
analyzed: māyā hastī yathā citram patrāṇi kanakāḥ yathā
translated: Just as a magical elephant is variegated, and gold is of the nature of leaves,

original: tathā dṛśyaṃ nṛṇāṃ khyāti citte ajñānavāsite // //
analyzed: tathā dṛśyam nṛṇām khyāti citte ajñāna vāsite
translated: In the same way, the appearance is known to men in the mind perfumed by ignorance.

original: āryo na paśyate bhrāntiṃ nāpi tattvaṃ tadantare /
analyzed: āryaḥ na paśyate bhrāntim na api tattvam tad antare
translated: The noble one does not see error, nor does he see reality in between.

analyzed: bhrāntiḥ eva bhavet tattvam yasmāt tattvam tad antare
translated: For the truth would be just an error, since the truth is within that.

original: bhrāntiṃ vidhūya sarvāṃ tu nimittaṃ yadi jāyate /
analyzed: bhrāntim vidhūya sarvām tu nimittam yadi jāyate
translated: If, having dispelled all error, a sign arises,

analyzed: sā eva ca asya bhavet bhrāntiḥ aśuddham timiram yathā
translated: that itself would be his error, like impure cataracts.

analyzed: keśoṇḍukam taimirikaḥ yathā gṛhṇāti vibhramāt
translated: Just as one with cataracts grasps a hair-net through delusion,

analyzed: viṣayeṣu tadvat bālānām grahaṇam saṃpravartate
translated: so the grasping of the foolish in regard to objects proceeds in the same way.

analyzed: keśoṇḍuka prakhyam idam marīci udaka vibhramam
translated: This world is like a hair-net, like the delusion of water in a mirage,

analyzed: tri bhavam svapna māyā ābham vimucyate
translated: contemplating the three worlds as like a dream or illusion, one is liberated.

analyzed: vikalpaḥ ca vikalpyaḥ ca vikalpasya pravartate
translated: The discrimination and the discriminated arise for the occurrence of discrimination.

analyzed: bandhaḥ bandhyaḥ ca baddhaḥ ca ṣaṭ ete mokṣa hetavaḥ
translated: Bondage, the bound, and the binder - these six are the causes of liberation.

original: na bhūmayo na satyāni na kṣetrā na ca nirmitāḥ /
analyzed: na bhūmayaḥ na satyāni na kṣetrāḥ na ca nirmitāḥ
translated: There are no stages, no truths, no fields, and no emanations,

analyzed: buddhāḥ pratyekabuddhāḥ ca śrāvakāḥ ca api kalpitāḥ
translated: buddhas, pratyekabuddhas, and śrāvakas are also imagined.

analyzed: pudgalaḥ saṃtatiḥ skandhāḥ pratyayāḥ hi aṇavaḥ tathā
translated: The person, continuum, aggregates, conditions, and atoms likewise,

analyzed: pradhānam īśvaraḥ kartā cittamātre vikalpyate
translated: primordial matter, Īśvara as the creator, are discriminated in mere mind.

original: cittaṃ hi sarvaṃ sarvatra sarvadeheṣu vartate /
analyzed: cittam hi sarvam sarvatra sarva deheṣu vartate
translated: For mind alone exists everywhere, in all bodies,

analyzed: vicitram gṛhyate sadbhiḥ cittamātram hi alakṣaṇam
translated: The mind is grasped as various by the unreal, for it is formless.

original: na hyātmā vidyate skandhe skandhāścaiva hi nātmani /
analyzed: na hi ātmā vidyate skandhe skandhāḥ ca eva hi na ātmani
translated: The self does not exist in the aggregates, nor do the aggregates exist in the self.

original: na te yathā vikalpyante na ca te vai na santi ca // //
analyzed: na te yathā vikalpyante na ca te vai na santi ca
translated: They are not as they are imagined, nor are they non-existent.

analyzed: astitvam sarva bhāvānām yathā bālaiḥ vikalpyate
translated: The existence of all things is imagined by the childish as it is.

analyzed: yadi te bhavet yathā dṛṣṭāḥ sarve syuḥ tattva darśinaḥ
translated: If they were as they are seen, all would be seers of reality.

analyzed: abhāvāt sarva dharmaṇām saṃkleśaḥ na asti ca
translated: Because of the non-existence of all dharmas, there is no defilement or purification.

original: na ca te tathā yathādṛṣṭā na ca te vai na santi ca // //🔽bhrāntirnimittaṃ saṃkalpaḥ paratantrasya lakṣaṇam /
analyzed: na ca te tathā yathā dṛṣṭāḥ na ca te vai na santi ca  bhrāntiḥ nimittam saṃkalpaḥ paratantrasya lakṣaṇam
translated: And they are not as they are seen, nor are they non-existent.🔽Error, sign, and conceptualization are the characteristics of the dependent.

analyzed: tasmin nimitte yat nāma tat vikalpita lakṣaṇam
translated: The name of that sign is the characteristic of the imagined.

analyzed: nāma nimitta saṃkalpaḥ yadā tasya na jāyate
translated: When the conceptualization of name and sign does not arise for him,

analyzed: pratyaya avastu saṃketam pariniṣpanna lakṣaṇam
translated: The object of conditions and convention is the characteristic of the perfected.

original: vaipākikāśca ye buddhā jinā nairmāṇikāśca ye /
analyzed: vaipākikāḥ ca ye buddhāḥ jināḥ nairmāṇikāḥ ca ye
translated: The Buddhas who are the results of evolution, the Victorious Ones who are emanations,

original: sattvāśca bodhisattvāśca kṣetrāṇi ca diśe diśe // //
analyzed: sattvāḥ ca bodhisattvāḥ ca kṣetrāṇi ca diśe diśe
translated: And the beings and Bodhisattvas and the fields in all directions,

analyzed: nisyanda dharma nirmāṇāḥ jināḥ nairmāṇikāḥ ca ye
translated: The emanations of the Victorious Ones who are the outflow of Dharma,

analyzed: sarve te hi amitābhasya sukhāvatyāḥ vinirgatāḥ
translated: All of them have emerged from Amitâbha's Sukhāvatī.

analyzed: yat ca nairmāṇikaiḥ bhāṣṭam yat ca bhāṣṭam vipāka jaiḥ
translated: What is spoken by the emanated ones and what is spoken by those born of evolution,

original: sūtrāntavaipulyanayaṃ tasya saṃdhiṃ vijānatha // //🔽yadbhāṣitaṃ jinasutairyacca bhāṣanti nāyakāḥ /
analyzed: sūtrānta vaipulya nayam tasya saṃdhim vijānatha  yat bhāṣitam jina sutaiḥ yat ca bhāṣanti nāyakāḥ
translated: Know the connection of that extensive teaching of the sūtras.🔽What is spoken by the sons of the victors and what is spoken by the guides,

analyzed: yat hi nairmāṇika ābhāṣṭam na tu vaipākikaiḥ jinaiḥ
translated: And what is spoken by the emanated ones, but not by the victors born of evolution.

original: anutpannā hyamī dharmā na caivaite na santi ca /
analyzed: anutpannāḥ hi amī dharmāḥ na ca eva ete na santi ca
translated: These phenomena are unborn, and they are not non-existent.

analyzed: gandharvanagara svapna māyā nirmāṇa sādṛśāḥ
translated: They are similar to a gandharva city, a dream, an illusion, and a magical creation.

analyzed: cittam pravartate cittam cittam eva vimucyate
translated: The mind arises, the mind appears, and the mind itself is liberated.

analyzed: cittam hi jāyate na anyat cittam eva nirudhyate
translated: The mind is born, not another mind, and the mind itself ceases.

original: arthābhāsaṃ nṛṇāṃ cittaṃ cittaṃ vai khyāti kalpitam /
analyzed: artha ābhāsam nṛṇām cittam cittam vai khyāti kalpitam
translated: The mind of humans appears as objects, and the mind appears as imagined.

analyzed: na asti arthaḥ cittamātrā iyam nirvikalpaḥ vimucyate  anādi kāla prapañca dauṣṭhulyam hi samāhitam
translated: There are no objects, this is mere mind. The non-conceptual one is liberated.🔽The latent tendency of conceptualization, which is the indisposition of conceptualization since beginningless time,

analyzed: vikalpaḥ bhāvitaḥ tena mithyā bhāsam pravartate
translated: Is cultivated. Therefore, false appearances occur.

analyzed: artha ābhāse ca vijñāne jñānam tathatā gocaram
translated: And in the consciousness that appears as objects, the wisdom that has suchness as its domain,

analyzed: parāvṛttam nirābhāsam āryāṇām gocare hi asau
translated: It is turned away, free from appearances, and is indeed the domain of the noble ones.

analyzed: artha pravicayam dhyānam dhyānam bāla upacārikam
translated: The investigation of objects is meditation, meditation is a convention for the childish.

analyzed: tathatā ārambaṇam dhyānam dhyānam tāthāgatam śubham
translated: Meditation with suchness as its object is meditation, meditation is the pure state of the Tathāgatas.

analyzed: parikalpitam svabhāvena sarva dharmāḥ a jānakāḥ
translated: All phenomena are without self-nature, not knowing the imagined nature,

analyzed: paratantram samāśritya vikalpaḥ bhramate nṛṇām
translated: Dependent on the relative, conceptualization wanders for humans.

analyzed: paratantram yathā śuddham vikalpena visaṃyutam
translated: As the relative is pure, free from conceptualization,

analyzed: parāvṛttam hi tathatā vihāraḥ kalpa varjitaḥ
translated: The transformed suchness is the abode, free from conceptualization.

original: mā vikalpaṃ vikalpetha vikalpo nāsti satyataḥ /🔽bhrāntiṃ vikalpayantasya grāhyagrāhakayorna tu /
analyzed: mā vikalpam vikalpetha vikalpaḥ na asti satyataḥ  bhrāntim vikalpayan tasya grāhya grāhakayoḥ na tu
translated: Do not conceptualize conceptualization, conceptualization does not exist in reality.🔽For one who conceptualizes error, there is the apprehended object and apprehending subject,

analyzed: bāhya artha darśanam kalpam svabhāvaḥ parikalpitaḥ
translated: The view of external objects is conceptualization, the imagined nature.

analyzed: yena kalpena kalpenti svabhāvaḥ pratyaya udbhavaḥ
translated: By what conceptualization they conceptualize, the nature arises from conditions.

analyzed: bāhya artha darśanam mithyā na asti artham cittam eva tu
translated: The view of external objects is false, there is no object, only mind.

analyzed: yuktyā vipaśyamānānām grāha grāhyam nirudhyate
translated: For those who contemplate with reasoning, the grasped and grasper cease.

original: bāhyo na vidyate hyartho yathā bālairvikalpyate // //
analyzed: bāhyaḥ na vidyate hi arthaḥ yathā bālaiḥ vikalpyate
translated: The external object does not exist as conceptualized by the childish.

analyzed: vāsanaiḥ lulitam cittam artha ābhāsam pravartate
translated: The mind, agitated by latent impressions, functions as the appearance of objects.

analyzed: kalpa dvaya nirodhena jñānam
translated: Knowledge with the cessation of the two conceptualizations has suchness as its domain.

analyzed: utpadyate hi anābhāsam acintyam ārya gocaram
translated: It arises without appearance, inconceivable, the domain of the noble ones.

analyzed: nāma nimitta saṃkalpaḥ svabhāva dvaya lakṣaṇam
translated: Name, sign, and conceptualization are characterized by the two natures.

analyzed: samyak jñānam hi tathatā pariniṣpanna lakṣaṇam
translated: Right knowledge is suchness, characterized by perfect accomplishment.

analyzed: mātā pitṛ samāyogāt ālaya mana saṃyutam
translated: From the union of mother and father, accompanied by the store-consciousness,

analyzed: ghṛta kumbhe mūṣikā yadvat saha śukreṇa vardhate
translated: Like a mouse in a pot of ghee, it grows together with semen.

analyzed: peśī ghana arbudam piṭakam aśubham karma citritam
translated: A lump, a solid mass, a blister, inauspicious, adorned with karma,

analyzed: karma vāyu mahābhūtaiḥ phala vat saṃprapadyate
translated: By the winds of karma and the great elements, it attains fruition.

analyzed: pañca pañcaka pañca eva vraṇāḥ ca eva navā eva tu
translated: Five sets of five, and five itself, and nine wounds,

analyzed: nakha danta roma saṃchannaḥ sphuramāṇaḥ prajāyate
translated: Covered with nails, teeth, and hair, throbbing, it is born.

analyzed: prajāta mātram viṣṭhā kṛmim supta buddhā iva mānavaḥ
translated: As soon as it is born, like a worm in feces, a human with dull senses,

original: cakṣuṣā sphurate rūpaṃ vivṛddhiṃ yāti kalpanāt // //
analyzed: cakṣuṣā sphurate rūpam vivṛddhim yāti kalpanāt
translated: Form throbs with the eye, it grows by conceptualization.

analyzed: tālu oṣṭha puṭa saṃyogāt vikalpena avadhāryate
translated: From the union of palate and lips, it is ascertained by conceptualization,

analyzed: vācā pravartate nṝṇām śukasya iva vikalpanā
translated: Speech proceeds among humans, like the conceptualization of a parrot.

analyzed: niścitāḥ tīrthya vādānām mahāyānam aniścitam
translated: The Mahāyāna is uncertain, while the doctrines of the tīrthikas are certain.

analyzed: sattva āśraya pravṛttā iyam kudṛṣṭīnām anāspadam
translated: This [Mahāyāna] is based on sentient beings and does not provide a basis for wrong views.

analyzed: pratyātma vedya yānam me tārkikāṇām agocaram
translated: My vehicle is to be known by oneself and is beyond the scope of logicians.

original: paścātkāle gate nāthe brūhi ko'yaṃ dhariṣyati // //
analyzed: paścātkāle gate nāthe brūhi kaḥ yam dhariṣyati
translated: When the Lord has passed away in the future, tell me who will uphold this [Mahāyāna]?

analyzed: nirvṛte sugate paścātkāla utītaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: When the Sugata has passed into nirvāṇa in the future, the time will have passed.

original: mahāmate nibodha tvaṃ yo netrīṃ dhārayiṣyati // //
analyzed: mahāmate nibodha tvam yaḥ netrīm dhārayiṣyati
translated: O Mahāmati, understand who will uphold the vehicle.

analyzed: dakṣiṇāpatha vedalyām bhikṣuḥ śrīmān mahā yaśāḥ
translated: In the southern region of Vedalyā, there will be a glorious and greatly renowned monk.

analyzed: nāgāhvayaḥ sa nāmnā tu sat asat pakṣa dārakaḥ
translated: His name will be Nāgāhvaya, and he will refute the positions of existence and non-existence.

analyzed: prakāśya loke mad yānam mahā yānam anuttaram
translated: Having revealed the unsurpassed Mahāyāna to the world,

analyzed: āsādya bhūmim muditām yāsyate au sukhāvatīm
translated: having attained the stage of joy, he will go to Sukhāvatī.

analyzed: buddhyā vivecyamānānām svabhāvaḥ na avadhāryate
translated: When examined with the intellect, no intrinsic nature is ascertained.

original: yasmāttadanabhilāpyāste niḥsvabhāvāśca deśitāḥ // //🔽pratyayotpādite hyarthe nāstyastīti na vidyate /
analyzed: yasmāt tat anabhilāpyāḥ te niḥsvabhāvāḥ ca deśitāḥ  pratyaya utpādite hi arthe na asti asti iti na vidyate
translated: Therefore, they are taught to be inexpressible and without intrinsic nature.🔽In a thing produced from conditions, existence and non-existence are not found.

original: pratyayāntargataṃ bhāvaṃ ye kalpentyasti nāsti ca /
analyzed: pratyaya antargatam bhāvam ye kalpenti asti nā asti ca
translated: Those who imagine a thing included within conditions to be existent or non-existent,

analyzed: dūrībhūtāḥ bhavet manye śāsanāt tīrtha dṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: I think the views of the tīrthikas have been removed by the teaching.

analyzed: abhidhānam sarva bhāvānām janma antara śataiḥ sadā
translated: The designation of all existents, always for hundreds of lifetimes,

analyzed: abhyastam abhyasantam ca paraspara vikalpayā
translated: is practiced and practiced by mutual conceptualization.

analyzed: a kathyamāne saṃmoham sarva loke āpadyate
translated: When it is not spoken of, the whole world falls into confusion.

analyzed: tasmāt kriyate nāma saṃmohasya vyudāsa artham
translated: Therefore, a name is made for the purpose of dispelling confusion.

analyzed: trividhena vikalpena bālaiḥ bhāvāḥ vikalpitāḥ
translated: By the threefold conceptualization, existents are conceptualized by the childish.

original: bhrāntirnāmavikalpena pratyayairjanitena ca // //🔽aniruddhā hyanutpannāḥ prakṛtyā gaganopamāḥ /
analyzed: bhrāntiḥ nāma vikalpena pratyayaiḥ janitena ca  aniruddhāḥ hi anutpannāḥ prakṛtyāḥ gagana upamāḥ
translated: Confusion is by the conceptualization of names and by the causes that produce it.🔽They are not ceased, not arisen, by nature like space,

analyzed: abhāva svabhāvāḥ ye tu te vikalpita lakṣaṇāḥ
translated: and those whose nature is non-existence have the characteristic of conceptualization.

analyzed: pratibhāsa bimba māyā ābha marīcyā supinena tu
translated: Like an appearance, an image, an illusion, a mirage, a dream,

analyzed: alāta cakra gandharva pratiśrutkā sama udbhavāḥ
translated: like the arising of a fire-wheel, a gandharva, and an echo,

analyzed: advayā tathatā śūnyā bhūtakoṣṭiḥ ca dharmatā
translated: the non-dual suchness, emptiness, the reality-limit, and the nature of dharmas,

analyzed: nirvikalpaḥ ca deśemi ye te niṣpanna lakṣaṇāḥ
translated: I teach the non-conceptual, which has the characteristic of accomplishment.

analyzed: vāc citta gocaram mithyā satyam prajñā vikalpitā
translated: False speech and mind-objects, wisdom is conceptualized as true,

analyzed: dvaya anta patitam cittam tasmāt prajñā na kalpitā
translated: and the mind falls into the extreme of duality, therefore wisdom is not conceptualized.

original: asti nāsti ca dvāvantau yāvaccittasya gocaraḥ /
analyzed: asti na asti ca dvau antau yāvat cittasya gocaraḥ
translated: Existence and non-existence are two extremes, as far as the sphere of mind is concerned.

analyzed: gocareṇa vidhūtena samyak cittam nirudhyate
translated: When the sphere is blown away, the mind is properly stopped.

analyzed: viṣaya grahaṇa abhāvāt nirodhena ca nā asti ca
translated: Due to the absence of grasping objects, there is also non-existence through cessation.

analyzed: vidyate tathatā avasthā āryāṇām gocaraḥ yathā
translated: The state of suchness exists, as the sphere of the noble ones.

original: bālānāṃ na tathā khyāti yathā khyāti manīṣiṇām /
analyzed: bālānām na tathā khyāti yathā khyāti manīṣiṇām
translated: It does not appear to the childish as it appears to the wise.

analyzed: manīṣiṇām tathā khyāti sarva dharmāḥ alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: To the wise, all phenomena appear as characterless.

analyzed: hārakūṭam yathā bālaiḥ suvarṇam parikalpyate
translated: Just as a glass trinket is imagined by the childish to be gold,

analyzed: asuvarṇam suvarṇa ābham tathā dharmāḥ ku tārkikaiḥ
translated: so are phenomena by bad logicians, not gold but appearing as gold.

original: abhūtvā yasya cotpādo bhūtvā cāpi vinaśyati /
analyzed: a bhūtvā yasya ca utpādaḥ bhūtvā ca api vinaśyati
translated: One who believes in the production of what did not exist before and the destruction of what did exist,

original: pratyayaiḥ sadasaccāpi na te me śāsane sthitāḥ // //
analyzed: pratyayaiḥ sat asat ca api na te me śāsane sthitāḥ
translated: and in the existent and non-existent through conditions, is not in my teaching.

analyzed: anādya nidhana abhāvāt bhūta lakṣaṇa saṃsthitāḥ
translated: Because of the absence of beginning and end, abiding in the characteristic of reality,

analyzed: kāraṇa kara vat loke na ca budhyanti tārkikāḥ
translated: the logicians do not understand the world as created by causes.

original: atīto vidyate bhāvo vidyate ca anāgataḥ /
analyzed: atītaḥ vidyate bhāvaḥ vidyate ca anāgataḥ
translated: An existent in the past exists, and an existent in the future exists,

analyzed: pratyakṣaḥ vidyate yasmāt tasmāt bhāvāḥ ajātakāḥ
translated: because it is directly perceived, therefore phenomena are unborn.

analyzed: pariṇāma kāla saṃsthānam bhūta bhāva indriyeṣu ca
translated: The arrangement of transformation, time, and the elements, substances, and senses,

original: antarābhavasaṃgrāhaṃ ye kalpanti na te budhāḥ // //
analyzed: antar ābhava saṃgrāham ye kalpanti na te budhāḥ
translated: Those who conceive of it as grasping the intermediate existence are not wise.

original: na pratītyasamutpannaṃ lokaṃ varṇanti vai jināḥ /
analyzed: na pratītyasamutpannam lokam varṇanti vai jināḥ
translated: The Victorious Ones do not describe the world as dependently arisen,

analyzed: kim tu pratyayam eva ayam lokaḥ gandharva saṃnibhaḥ
translated: But rather this world of conditions is like a gandharva city.

analyzed: dharma saṃketaḥ eva ayam tasmin tat idam ucyate
translated: This is merely a convention of phenomena, and that is said to be so.

original: saṃketācca pṛthagbhūto na jāto na nirudhyate // //
analyzed: saṃketāt ca pṛthak bhūtaḥ na jātaḥ na nirudhyate
translated: And being separate from convention, it is neither born nor ceases.

original: darpaṇe udake netre bhāṇḍeṣu ca maṇīṣu ca /
analyzed: darpaṇe udake netre bhāṇḍeṣu ca maṇīṣu ca
translated: In a mirror, in water, in the eyes, and in gems,

original: bimbaṃ hi dṛśyate teṣu na ca bimbo'sti kutracit // //
analyzed: bimbam hi dṛśyate teṣu na ca bimbā asti kutracid
translated: An image is seen, but an image does not exist anywhere.

original: bhāvābhāsaṃ tathā cittaṃ mṛgatṛṣṇā yathā nabhe /
analyzed: bhāva ābhāsam tathā cittam mṛgatṛṣṇā yathā nabhe
translated: Likewise, the mind appears as an existent thing, like a mirage in the sky,

analyzed: dṛśyate citra rūpeṇa svapne vandhyā aurasaḥ yathā
translated: Seen with various forms, like a barren woman's son in a dream.

original: na me yānaṃ mahāyānaṃ na ghoṣo na ca akṣarāḥ /
analyzed: na me yānam mahā yānam na ghoṣaḥ na ca akṣarāḥ
translated: My vehicle is not the Great Vehicle, nor is it sound or syllables,

original: na satyā na vimokṣā vai na nirābhāsagocaram // //
analyzed: na satyāḥ na vimokṣāḥ vai na nirābhāsa gocaram
translated: Nor is it the truths or liberations, nor is it the sphere of non-appearance.

analyzed: kim tu yānam mahāyānam samādhi vaśa varti tā
translated: But the vehicle is the Great Vehicle, mastery over concentration,

analyzed: kāyam manaḥ mayam citram vaśitā puṣpa maṇḍitam
translated: The mind-made body with various forms, adorned with the flowers of mastery.

original: ekatvena pṛthaktvena bhāvo vai pratyaye na tu /
analyzed: eka tvena pṛthak tvena bhāvaḥ vai pratyaye na tu
translated: Existence is not in the condition as one or separate.

original: janma samāsamevoktaṃ nirodho nāśa eva hi // //
analyzed: janma samāsam eva uktam nirodhaḥ nāśaḥ eva hi
translated: Birth is said to be the same as coming together, and cessation is just destruction.

analyzed: ajāta śūnyatā ca ekam ekam jāteṣu śūnyatā
translated: Non-arisen emptiness is one, and emptiness in arisen things is another.

analyzed: ajāta śūnyatā śreṣṭhā naśyate jāta śūnyatā
translated: Non-arisen emptiness is supreme, arisen emptiness is destroyed.

analyzed: tathatā śūnyatā koṭī nirvāṇam dharmadhātu vat
translated: Suchness, emptiness, the extreme, nirvana, and the dharma realm -

analyzed: kāyaḥ manaḥ mayam citram paryāyaiḥ deśitam mayā
translated: The mind-made body is diverse, taught by me through synonyms.

analyzed: sūtra vinaya abhidharmeṇa viśuddhim kalpayanti ye
translated: Those who imagine purity through the sutras, vinaya, and abhidharma,

original: granthato na tu arthena na te nairātmyamāśritāḥ // //
analyzed: granthataḥ na tu arthena na te nairātmyam āśritāḥ
translated: By the text but not by the meaning, they are not based in non-self.

original: na tīrthikairna buddhaiśca na mayā na ca kenacit /
analyzed: na tīrthikaiḥ na buddhaiḥ ca na mayā na ca kenacid
translated: Not by non-Buddhists, not by the Buddhas, not by me, and not by anyone else -

analyzed: pratyayaiḥ sādhita astitvam katham nāstiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: How can non-existence be, when existence is established by conditions?

analyzed: kena prasādhita astitvam pratyayaiḥ yasya nāstitā
translated: By whom is existence established, whose non-existence is by conditions?

analyzed: utpāda vāda durdṛṣṭyā na asti asti iti vikalpayet
translated: One would discriminate existence and non-existence due to the wrong view of the doctrine of origination.

analyzed: yasya nā utpadyate kiṃcid na kiṃcid tam nirudhyate
translated: For whom nothing arises and nothing ceases,

analyzed: tasya asti nāsti na upaiti viviktam paśyataḥ jagat
translated: For him, seeing the world as secluded, existence and non-existence do not apply.

analyzed: dṛśyate śaśaviṣāṇa ākhyam vikalpaḥ vidyate nṛṇām
translated: The conceptual thought called like a rabbit's horns is seen to exist in people.

original: ye tu kalpenti te bhrāntā mṛgatṛṣṇāṃ yathā mṛgāḥ // //
analyzed: ye tu kalpenti te bhrāntāḥ mṛgatṛṣṇām yathā mṛgāḥ
translated: But those who imagine it are deluded, like deer in a mirage.

analyzed: vikalpa abhiniveśena vikalpaḥ saṃpravartate
translated: Conceptual thought arises through attachment to conceptual thought.

original: nirhetukaṃ vikalpaṃ hi vikalpo'pi na yujyate // //
analyzed: nirhetukam vikalpam hi vikalpaḥ api na yujyate
translated: For conceptual thought is not tenable without a cause for conceptual thought.

original: ajale ca jalagrāho mṛgatṛṣṇā yathā nabhe /
analyzed: ajale ca jala grāhaḥ mṛgatṛṣṇā yathā nabhe
translated: Just as the perception of water in the absence of water, like a mirage in the sky,

analyzed: dṛśyate īrthaḥ hi bālānām āryāṇām na viśeṣataḥ
translated: The object is seen by the childish, but not by the noble ones.

analyzed: āryāṇām darśanam śuddham vimokṣa traya saṃbhavam
translated: The vision of the noble ones is pure, arising from the three liberations,

analyzed: utpāda bhaṅga nirmuktam nirābhāsa pracāriṇam
translated: Free from origination and destruction, operating without appearances.

analyzed: gāmbhīrya udārya vaipulyam jñānam kṣetrān ca
translated: The knowledge of profundity, vastness, and abundance, and the powers,

analyzed: deśemi jinaputrāṇām śrāvakāṇām anitya tām
translated: I teach to the sons of the victors, to the hearers impermanence.

analyzed: anityam tri bhavam śūnyam ātma ātmīya vivarjitam
translated: The three realms are impermanent, empty, devoid of self and what belongs to self,

analyzed: śrāvakāṇām ca deśemi tathā sāmānya lakṣaṇam
translated: And I teach to the hearers the general characteristics as well.

analyzed: sarva dharmeṣu asaṃsaktiḥ vivekā hi ekacārikā
translated: Non-attachment to all phenomena, solitude, and solitary wandering,

analyzed: pratyeka jinaputrāṇām phalam deśemi atarkikam
translated: I teach the result that is beyond reasoning to the sons of the victors who are pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: svabhāva kalpitam bāhyam paratantram ca dehinām
translated: The imagined nature is external, and the dependent nature is of embodied beings.

analyzed: a paśyan ātma saṃbhrāntim tatas cittam pravartate
translated: Not seeing the error of the self, the mind then proceeds.

original: daśamī tu bhavetprathamī prathamī cāṣṭamī bhavet /
analyzed: daśamī tu bhavet prathamī prathamī ca aṣṭamī bhavet
translated: The tenth should be the first, and the first should be the eighth.

original: navamī saptamī cāpi saptamī cāṣṭamī bhavet // //
analyzed: navamī saptamī ca api saptamī ca aṣṭamī bhavet
translated: The ninth should be the seventh, and the seventh should be the eighth.

original: dvitīyā tu tṛtīyā syāccaturthī pañcamī bhavet /
analyzed: dvitīyā tu tṛtīyā syāt caturthī pañcamī bhavet
translated: The second should be the third, and the fourth should be the fifth.

original: tṛtīyā tu bhavetṣaṣṭhī nirābhāse kramaḥ kutaḥ // //
analyzed: tṛtīyā tu bhavet ṣaṣṭhī nirābhāse kramaḥ kutas
translated: The third should be the sixth. In the non-appearance, how is there a sequence?

analyzed: nirābhāsaḥ hi bhāvānām abhāvaḥ nā asti yoginām
translated: For yogis, the non-appearance of phenomena is not non-existence.

analyzed: bhāva abhāva sama tvena āryāṇām jāyate phalam
translated: The result of the noble ones arises from the equality of the existence and non-existence of phenomena.

original: kathaṃ hyabhāvo bhāvānāṃ kurute samatāṃ katham /
analyzed: katham hi abhāvaḥ bhāvānām kurute samatām katham
translated: How does non-existence make equality with phenomena? How?

original: yadā cittaṃ na jānāti bāhyamadhyātmikaṃ calam /
analyzed: yadā cittam na jānāti bāhyam adhyātmikam calam
translated: When the mind does not know the external and internal movement,

analyzed: tadā tu kurute nāśam samatā citta darśanāt
translated: then it makes destruction by seeing the equality of the mind.

analyzed: anādimati saṃsāre bhāva grāha upagūhitam
translated: In beginningless cyclic existence, it is covered by the attachment to the conception of existence.

original: bālaiḥ kīla yathā kīlaṃ pralobhya vinivartate // //
analyzed: bālaiḥ kīla yathā kīlam pralobhya vinivartate
translated: By children, like a nail is driven out by a nail, it is turned away.

analyzed: tad hetukam tad ālambyam manogati samāśrayam
translated: That which is the cause of that, that which is the basis of the mind's movement,

original: hetuṃ dadāti cittasya vijñānaṃ ca samāśritam // //
analyzed: hetum dadāti cittasya vijñānam ca samāśritam
translated: And gives rise to the mind, depending on consciousness.

analyzed: vaipākikāt adhiṣṭhānām nikāya gati saṃbhavāt
translated: From the ripening of the sense bases, the arising of the groups and destinies,

original: labhyante yena vai svapne abhijñāśca caturvidhāḥ // //
analyzed: labhyante yena vai svapne abhijñāḥ ca caturvidhāḥ
translated: By which the four kinds of supernormal knowledge are attained in dreams.

original: svapne ca labhyate yacca yacca buddhaprasādataḥ /
analyzed: svapne ca labhyate yat ca yat ca buddha prasādataḥ
translated: And what is attained in dreams, and what from faith in the Buddha,

analyzed: nikāya gati gotrāḥ ye te vijñāna vipāka jāḥ
translated: Those of the groups, destinies, and lineages are born from the ripening of consciousness.

analyzed: vāsanaiḥ bhāvitam cittam bhāva ābhāsam pravartate
translated: The mind, imprinted with latent tendencies, proceeds with the appearance of entities.

original: bālā yadā na budhyante utpādaṃ deśayettadā // //
analyzed: bālāḥ yadā na budhyante utpādam deśayet tadā
translated: When the childish do not understand, then the arising should be taught.

analyzed: yāvat vākyam vikalpeti bhāvam vai lakṣaṇa anvitam
translated: As long as one conceptualizes a statement with the appearance of an entity endowed with characteristics,

analyzed: tāvat vibudhyate cittam apaśyān hi sva vibhramam
translated: For that long the mind is deluded, not seeing its own error.

analyzed: utpādaḥ varṇyate kasmāt kasmāt dṛśyam na varṇyate
translated: Why is arising described? Why is the visible not described?

original: adṛśyaṃ dṛśyamānaṃ hi kasya kiṃ varṇyate kutaḥ // //
analyzed: adṛśyam dṛśyamānam hi kasya kim varṇyate kutas
translated: For the invisible is seen, so what of someone is described from where?

analyzed: svaccham cittam svabhāvena manaḥ kaluṣa kārakam
translated: The mind is naturally clear, the mind is the defiler.

analyzed: manaḥ ca saha vijñānaiḥ vāsanām kṣipate sadā
translated: And the mind together with the consciousnesses always casts out latent tendencies.

original: ālayo muñcate kāyaṃ manaḥ prārthayate gatim /
analyzed: ālayaḥ muñcate kāyam manaḥ prārthayate gatim
translated: The storehouse consciousness releases the body, the mind seeks a destiny.

analyzed: vijñānam viṣaya ābhāsam bhrāntim dṛṣṭvā pralabhyate
translated: Seeing consciousness appearing as objects, one is deluded and deceived.

original: madīyaṃ dṛśyate cittaṃ bāhyamarthaṃ na vidyate /
analyzed: madīyam dṛśyate cittam bāhyam artham na vidyate
translated: My mind is seen, but the external object does not exist.

analyzed: evam vibhāvayet bhrāntim tathatām ca api anusmaret
translated: Thus one should contemplate delusion and also recollect suchness.

analyzed: dhyāyinām viṣayaḥ karma buddha māhātmyam eva ca
translated: The object of meditation, karma, and the greatness of the Buddha,

analyzed: etāni trīṇi acintyāni acintyam vijñāna gocaram
translated: These three are inconceivable, the inconceivable is the domain of consciousness.

analyzed: anāgatam atītam ca nirvāṇam pudgalam vacaḥ
translated: The future, the past, nirvana, the individual, and speech,

analyzed: saṃvṛtyā deśayāmi etān parama arthaḥ tu anakṣaraḥ
translated: I teach these conventionally, but the ultimate is inexpressible.

analyzed: naikāyikāḥ ca tīrthyāḥ ca dṛṣṭim eka aṃśam āśritāḥ
translated: The non-Buddhist schools and the non-Buddhists, relying on a single view,

analyzed: cittamātre visaṃmūḍhāḥ bhāvam kalpenti bāhiram
translated: Confused about mere mind, imagine an external existence.

analyzed: pratyeka bodhim buddha tvam arhat tvam buddha darśanam
translated: Individual enlightenment, buddhahood, arhatship, seeing the Buddha,

original: gūḍhabījaṃ bhavedbodhau svapne vai sidhyate tu yaḥ // //
analyzed: gūḍha bījam bhavet bodhau svapne vai sidhyate tu yaḥ
translated: The hidden seed may be in enlightenment, what is accomplished in a dream.

original: kutra keṣāṃ kathaṃ kasmātkimarthaṃ ca vadāhi me /🔽mayācittamatiśāntaṃ sadasatpakṣadeśanām // //
analyzed: kutra keṣām katham kasmāt kim artham ca vadāhi me  mayā acittam ati śāntam sat asat pakṣa deśanām
translated: Where, for whom, how, why, tell me,🔽My mind is very peaceful, teaching the side of existence and non-existence.

analyzed: cittamātre vimūḍhānām māyā nāstyastideśanām
translated: For the confused about mere mind, the teaching of existence and non-existence of illusion,

analyzed: utpāda bhaṅga saṃyuktam lakṣya lakṣaṇa varjitam
translated: Endowed with origination and destruction, devoid of the characterized and the characteristic.

original: vikalpo mano nāma vijñānaiḥ pañcabhiḥ saha /
analyzed: vikalpaḥ manaḥ nāma vijñānaiḥ pañcabhiḥ saha
translated: Conceptual mind is called together with the five consciousnesses.
The seed of mind functions in what is like a flood of images in water, and so on.

original: yadā cittaṃ manaścāpi vijñānaṃ na pravartate /
analyzed: yadā cittam manaḥ ca api vijñānam na pravartate
translated: And when mind and also thought do not function,

original: tadā manomayaṃ kāyaṃ labhate buddhabhūmi ca // //
analyzed: tadā manaḥ mayam kāyam labhate buddha bhūmi ca
translated: then one obtains a body consisting of mind and the stage of a Buddha.

original: pratyayā dhātavaḥ skandhā dharmāṇāṃ ca svalakṣaṇam /
analyzed: pratyayāḥ dhātavaḥ skandhāḥ dharmāṇām ca sva lakṣaṇam
translated: The conditions, the elements, the aggregates, and the intrinsic characteristics of phenomena,

analyzed: prajñaptim pudgalam cittam svapna keśoṇḍuka upamāḥ
translated: The designation of a person, and the mind are like a dream, a hair net.

analyzed: māyā svapna upamam lokam dṛṣṭvā tattvam samāśrayet
translated: Having seen the world as like an illusion and a dream, one should rely on reality.

original: tattvaṃ hi lakṣaṇairmuktaṃ yuktihetuvivarjitam // //🔽pratyātmavedyamāryāṇāṃ vihāraṃ tu smaretsadā /
analyzed: tattvam hi lakṣaṇaiḥ muktam yukti hetu vivarjitam  pratyātma vedyam āryāṇām vihāram tu smaret sadā
translated: For reality is free from characteristics and devoid of logical reasons.🔽One should always remember the abode of the noble ones, which is to be known by oneself.

analyzed: yukti hetu visaṃmūḍham lokam tattve niveśayet
translated: One should establish the world in reality, which is not confused by logical reasons.

analyzed: sarva prapañca upaśamāt bhrāntaḥ na abhipravartate
translated: Because of the cessation of all conceptual proliferation, delusion does not arise.

analyzed: prajñāḥ yāvat vikalpante bhrāntiḥ tāvat pravartate
translated: As long as wisdom is conceptualized, delusion functions.

original: naiḥsvabhāvyaṃ ca bhāvaṃ ca śūnyā vai nityānityatā /
analyzed: naiḥsvabhāvyam ca bhāvam ca śūnyā vai nitya anitya tā
translated: The absence of intrinsic nature and existence, emptiness, and permanence and impermanence,

analyzed: utpāda vādinām dṛṣṭiḥ na tu anutpāda vādinām
translated: The view of those who believe in origination, not of those who believe in non-origination.

analyzed: ekatvam anyatva ubhayām īśvarāt ca yadṛcchayā
translated: Unity, difference, both, and by chance from God,

original: kālāpradhānādanyebhiḥ pratyayaiḥ kalpyate jagat // //🔽saṃsārabījaṃ vijñānaṃ sati dṛśye pravartate /
analyzed: kāla a pradhānāt anyebhiḥ pratyayaiḥ kalpyate jagat  saṃsāra bījam vijñānam sati dṛśye pravartate
translated: The world is imagined by other conditions, not by time as the primary cause.🔽Consciousness, the seed of saṃsāra, operates when there is an object to be seen.

original: kuḍye sati yathā citraṃ parijñānānnirudhyate // //🔽māyāpuruṣavannṝṇāṃ mṛtajanma pravartate /
analyzed: kuḍye sati yathā citram parijñānāt nirudhyate  māyā puruṣa vat nṝṇām mṛta janma pravartate
